title: Norwich v Manchester United betting odds: Away win favourable
text:
Norwich City and Manchester United meet with just three points separating them and both craving a win in Sunday’s Premier League game

United finding some form

Manchester United will be hoping to continue their resurgence after ending Liverpool’s 100 per cent start to the season.

The most encouraging aspect of United’s performance against the European champions was their refusal to capitulate once the equaliser went in.

And a 1-0 win against Partizan Belgrade served as a reminder they are still capable of grinding out results.

There are undoubtedly still question marks over United’s defence but a game against Norwich presents a perfect opportunity to maintain their run.

The Canaries have kept just one clean sheet this season and conceded five at home against Aston Villa, while their injury list has also piled up.

Manchester United to win is 8/11 on Paddy Power.

Worrying signs for Norwich

Norwich have excited fans and neutrals alike with their free-flowing, attacking style of play since gaining promotion.

However, the Canaries have also been forced to confront the harsh reality that an enthralling style of play does not guarantee Premier League points.

Just seven from their opening nine games has exposed their lack of defensive steel and the 5-1 home thrashing at the hands of fellow promoted side Aston Villa was a huge wake-up call.

A goalless draw followed but Norwich finished the game without a recognised centre-back after Ben Godfrey was injured.

Manchester United, who are only three points above Norwich, have not scored more than one goal in a match since the opening day of the season so we can expect a cagey affair.

With three of Norwich’s last five games ending under 2.5 goals, Paddy Power have Under 2.5 Goals at 6/5.

Time for a Pukki party revival

The season started with such promise for Norwich’s Icelandic sensation Teemu Pukki, scoring five goals in his first three games.

However, only one goal in his last five has seen the ‘Pukki party’ come to an abrupt end.

Pukki’s last Norwich goal came in the stunning 3-2 win against Manchester City, where the Canaries showed they have the ability to raise their game for the big occasions.

With that result, and the fact that United’s defence is still more than capable of hitting the self-destruct button, Pukki could get back on track.

United have only kept two clean sheets this season and Paddy Power have Pukki to score anytime at 13/8.
description: Betting preview as Norwich and Manchester United meet with just three points separating them and both are in need of a win in Sunday’s Premier League game.
